results.title: Cave temples of India
results.creator_credit: Jagat Murari, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A vivid reminder of a great past when people created miracles in stone to express devotion to their gods. Shows some of the famous rock-cut shrines, including the caves at Badami, Elephanta and Ellora, dating from the 17th century. Explains the statues depicting the various incarnations of the Hindu deity. Commentary by Berkeley Hill.

results.title: Cattle country
results.brief_description: This film provides information on the beef cattle industry in Australia. It presents a general picture of beef cattle types, including the major British breeds, some tropical breeds, and the European exotics, now making their appearance in the country. Intended in particular for students and young farmers. No further credits available.

results.title: Caterpillar
results.brief_description: An animated story about a little boy and a small, green caterpillar that dances to the catchy tune the little boy plays on his mouth organ. Discovered by an entrepreneur, they soon become big business until the caterpillar seemingly disappears.

results.title: Casual encounters of the infectious kind. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: Part one of a two-part series. Provides basic factual information about infectious diseases which are transmitted by sexual contact. Stresses the importance of seeking proper medical examination and, if necessary, treatment.

results.title: Casual encounters of the infectious kind. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: Part two of a-part series. Explains the facilities available for medical examination and, if necessary, treatment of people who think they may have been exposed to sexually transmitted diseases.

results.title: The Cashew nut story
results.creator_credit: S.B. Nayampally, C L Aggarwal and National Education and Information Films
results.brief_description: The cashew nut industry in Kerala, India. Part of the Indian Government five-year plan is to promote and develop this growing industry. With government loans and cashew tree cuttings, the Development Officer encourages local farmers to help poor farms become self-supporting. he advises the planting of other crops between the trees. The cashew crop is sold to a co-operative store where it is dried, bagged, weighed, roasted, shelled, graded then finally packed for world-wide export.

results.title: Caroline
results.creator_credit: Clement Perron, Georges Dufaux and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: To the public she is the pleasant, never-ruffled handler of everyone’s complaints at the telephone company. But behind her calm exterior the film reveals her doubts about her personal life, the domestic world of husband and child.

results.title: Careering into marriage
results.creator_credit: Susan Doring, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. Stresses the importance of career planning for girls, even though they may marry and leave work permanently or have a broken career. Many women become the breadwinners of their family, and others manage to successfully combine career and family.

results.title: The Car Stealers
results.creator_credit: Eric L. Morris, Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Services and Council of Fire and Accident Underwriters
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the problem of car theft and joy-riding by young teenagers in Australia. Points out to car owners and parents how their carelessness can be partly responsible. Shows safety devices and security checks for car-owners. Made with the co-operation of the Victorian Police.
